translated: Itivuttaka
The Collection of Threes
The fourth sub-chapter
For the benefit of many people

analyzed: vuttam ha etam bhagavatā vuttam arahatā iti me suta
translated: This was said by the Blessed One, the Worthy One, the Perfect Sambuddha, so I have heard:

original: “Tayome puggalā loke uppajjamānā uppajjanti bahujanahitāya bahujanasukhāya lokānukampāya atthāya hitāya sukhāya devamanussānaṁ.
analyzed: tayo ume puggalāḥ loke uppajjamānāḥ uppajjanti bahu jana hitāya bahu jana sukhāya loka anukampāya atthāya hitāya sukhāya deva manussāna
translated: “Three people arise in the world for the benefit of many people, for the happiness of many people, out of compassion for the world, for the welfare, benefit, and happiness of devas and humans.
What are the three?

original: Idha, bhikkhave, tathāgato loke uppajjati arahaṁ sammāsambuddho vijjācaraṇasampanno sugato lokavidū anuttaro purisadammasārathi satthā devamanussānaṁ buddho bhagavā.
analyzed: idha bhikkhave tathāgataḥ loke uppajjati araham sammāsambuddhaḥ vijjā caraṇa sampannaḥ sugataḥ loka vidū anuttaraḥ purisa damma sārathi satthā deva manussānam buddhaḥ bhagavā
translated: Here, monks, a Tathāgata arises in the world, an arahant, a Perfectly Enlightened One, accomplished in knowledge and conduct, a Well-Farer, a Knower of the worlds, an unsurpassed trainer of those who can be trained, a teacher of devas and humans, an enlightened one, a Blessed One.

original: So dhammaṁ deseti ādikalyāṇaṁ majjhekalyāṇaṁ pariyosānakalyāṇaṁ sātthaṁ sabyañjanaṁ, kevalaparipuṇṇaṁ parisuddhaṁ brahmacariyaṁ pakāseti.
analyzed: saḥ dhammam deseti ādi kalyāṇam majjhe kalyāṇam pariyosāna kalyāṇam sa attham sa byañjana kevala paripuṇṇam parisuddham brahmacariyam pakāseti
translated: He teaches the Dhamma that is good in the beginning, good in the middle, and good in the end, with its own meaning and phrasing, and reveals a holy life that is utterly perfect and pure.

original: Ayaṁ, bhikkhave, paṭhamo puggalo loke uppajjamāno uppajjati bahujanahitāya bahujanasukhāya lokānukampāya atthāya hitāya sukhāya devamanussānaṁ.
analyzed: aya bhikkhave paṭhamaḥ puggalaḥ loke uppajjamānaḥ uppajjati bahu jana hitāya bahu jana sukhāya loka anukampāya atthāya hitāya sukhāya deva manussāna
translated: This, monks, is the first person who arises in the world for the benefit of many people, for the happiness of many people, out of compassion for the world, for the welfare, benefit, and happiness of devas and humans.

original: Puna caparaṁ, bhikkhave, tasseva satthu sāvako arahaṁ hoti khīṇāsavo vusitavā katakaraṇīyo ohitabhāro anuppattasadattho parikkhīṇabhavasaṁyojano sammadaññāvimutto.
analyzed: puna capara bhikkhave tassa iva satthu sāvakaḥ araham hoti khīṇa āsavaḥ vusitavā kata karaṇīyaḥ ohita bhāraḥ an uppatta sadattho parikkhīṇa bhava sayojanaḥ sammad aññā vimutto
translated: “Again, a disciple of that teacher is a perfected one, whose effluents are ended, who has reached fulfillment, done the task, laid down the burden, attained the true goal, destroyed the fetters of becoming, and is released through right gnosis.

original: So dhammaṁ deseti ādikalyāṇaṁ majjhekalyāṇaṁ pariyosānakalyāṇaṁ sātthaṁ sabyañjanaṁ, kevalaparipuṇṇaṁ parisuddhaṁ brahmacariyaṁ pakāseti.
analyzed: saḥ dhammam deseti ādi kalyāṇam majjhe kalyāṇam pariyosāna kalyāṇam sa attham sa byañjana kevala paripuṇṇam parisuddham brahmacariyam pakāseti
translated: He teaches the Dhamma that’s good in the beginning, good in the middle, and good in the end, with the right meaning and phrasing; he reveals a holy life that’s entirely perfect, pure, and clean.

original: Ayaṁ, bhikkhave, dutiyo puggalo loke uppajjamāno uppajjati bahujanahitāya bahujanasukhāya lokānukampāya atthāya hitāya sukhāya devamanussānaṁ.
analyzed: aya bhikkhave dutiyaḥ puggalaḥ loke uppajjamānaḥ uppajjati bahu jana hitāya bahu jana sukhāya loka anukampāya atthāya hitāya sukhāya deva manussāna
translated: This is the second person who appears in the world for the welfare of the multitude, for the happiness of the multitude, in sympathy for the world, for the good, welfare, & happiness of devas & human beings.

original: Puna caparaṁ, bhikkhave, tasseva satthu sāvako sekho hoti pāṭipado bahussuto sīlavatūpapanno.
analyzed: puna capara bhikkhave tassa iva satthu sāvakaḥ sekhaḥ hoti pāṭipadaḥ bahu sutaḥ sīlavat tu upapannaḥ
translated: “Again, a disciple of that teacher is a trainee, a learner, one who continues to study, one who continues to strive.

original: Sopi dhammaṁ deseti ādikalyāṇaṁ majjhekalyāṇaṁ pariyosānakalyāṇaṁ sātthaṁ sabyañjanaṁ, kevalaparipuṇṇaṁ parisuddhaṁ brahmacariyaṁ pakāseti.
analyzed: saḥ api dhammam deseti ādi kalyāṇam majjhe kalyāṇam pariyosāna kalyāṇam sa attham sa byañjana kevala paripuṇṇam parisuddham brahmacariyam pakāseti
translated: He, too, teaches the Dhamma that’s good in the beginning, good in the middle, and good in the end, with the right meaning and phrasing; he reveals a holy life that’s entirely perfect, pure, and clean.

original: Ayaṁ, bhikkhave, tatiyo puggalo loke uppajjamāno uppajjati bahujanahitāya bahujanasukhāya lokānukampāya atthāya hitāya sukhāya devamanussānaṁ.
analyzed: aya bhikkhave tatiyaḥ puggalaḥ loke uppajjamānaḥ uppajjati bahu jana hitāya bahu jana sukhāya loka anukampāya atthāya hitāya sukhāya deva manussāna
translated: This is the third person who appears in the world for the welfare of the multitude, for the happiness of the multitude, out of compassion for the world, for the good, welfare, and happiness of devas and humans.

original: Ime kho, bhikkhave, tayo puggalā loke uppajjamānā uppajjanti bahujanahitāya bahujanasukhāya lokānukampāya atthāya hitāya sukhāya devamanussānan”ti.🔽Etamatthaṁ bhagavā avoca.
analyzed: ime kho bhikkhave tayo puggalāḥ loke uppajjamānāḥ uppajjanti bahu jana hitāya bahu jana sukhāya loka anukampāya atthāya hitāya sukhāya deva manussānam ti  etam attham bhagavān avoca
translated: These are the three persons who appear in the world for the welfare of the multitude, for the happiness of the multitude, out of compassion for the world, for the good, welfare, and happiness of devas and humans.”
The Buddha spoke this verse:
“The Teacher, the foremost great seer in the world,
His disciple, developed, is second;
Then a third, a trainee on the path,
Learned, virtuous, and accomplished.
These three, best among devas and humans,
Shining forth, proclaiming the Dhamma,
Open the door to the deathless,

original: Yogā pamocenti bahujjanaṁ te.🔽Ye satthavāhena anuttarena,
analyzed: yogā bahujjanam te  ye satthavāhena anuttarena
translated: Liberating many from bondage.🔽Those who follow the unsurpassed path
Well-taught by the caravan leader,
Here and now make an end to suffering,
Vigilant in the Sugata’s instruction.”

original: Ayampi attho vutto bhagavatā, iti me sutanti.
analyzed: ayam pi atthaḥ vuttaḥ bhagavatā iti me sutam ti
translated: This is the meaning of what was said by the Blessed One, so I have heard.
The fifth.
